Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/10/2022. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability
Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial
compliance has been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
1.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: None at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Optimist House submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
 2022C0217017 Optimist House is in compliance with this corrective action plan
for R 400.4142. All medication is stored and dispensed from the main campus
nursing office. Medication storage and dispensing has not been a further issue
at Optimist House.
 2022C0325018 Optimist House is in compliance with this corrective action plan
for R 400.4166. All staff were trained that respite care between Whaley Center
for Children facilities is not permitted. DHHS 3600 and DHHS 69 forms must
be completed when a youth moves from one license to another license.
Respite care has not reoccurred at Optimist House.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
